Title: The Problem with Doing Good ï½œ Tao Te Ching Chapter 38 Explained Part 1
Content: Consider the following advice from Taoism: focus on becoming virtuous rather than merely performing virtuous acts. Understand that motivations behind good actions can vary widely, and strive for genuine goodness rather than external pressures. Embrace flexibility and intuition as guides, and remember that any person, regardless of their religious beliefs, can follow the principles of Taoism to achieve inner harmony and genuine goodness.
